intro: Galium pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and covered with fine hairs. Galium pauciflorum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
